* The present invention is a wave-based imaging method that utilizes radial reflection diffraction tomography (RRDT) to map angular location and frequency parameters of scattered energy waves to construct images of objects.
* The method can be applied to various fields, including intravascular imaging for characterizing plaque, non-destructive evaluation of buried wastes or materials, and elastography for determining the elastic properties of a surrounding medium. The Hilbert space inverse wave (HSIW) algorithm is used to invert the collected data and obtain the final image.

• The invention is a board game with a lake theme that includes a playing board, tokens, title deed cards, game pieces, a source of scrip, and elements for randomly determining movement.
• The playing board has a continuous path with spaces representing lake areas, dams, boat dealerships, and other lake-related spaces. Players can purchase lake areas and improve them with cabins and marinas.
• Renting or passing GO can result in collecting or paying money, while landing on certain spaces can require following instructions or drawing cards with penalties, rewards, or both.
• Players can mortgage properties to the Bank, but doing so prevents them from collecting rental income if another player lands on their property.
• Bankruptcy occurs when a player is unable to pay their obligations, resulting in the loss of their scrip, lake cabins and marinas, and the sale of their remaining lake areas, boat dealerships, and dams.
• The game continues until all but one player is bankrupt, at which point the remaining player is declared the winner.

• The present invention relates to a cardiac assist system that includes a device and algorithm for a combined cardiomyostimulator and cardiac pacer-cardioverter-defibrillator.
• The system delivers stimulation to a skeletal muscle grafted about a heart, senses depolarizations of the patient's heart, measures intervals between successive depolarizations, and inhibits muscle stimulation upon sensing a depolarization within certain intervals.
• The system detects the occurrence of a first type of arrhythmia when the number of measured intervals falling within the first interval range equals a first predetermined value, and delivers a first type of arrhythmia therapy in response.
• The system detects the occurrence of a second type of arrhythmia when the number of intervals falling within the second interval range equals a second predetermined value, and delivers a second type of arrhythmia therapy in response, which has a cardiac stimulation component and a skeletal muscle component.
• The system permits rapid detection of a cardiac arrhythmia and provides cardiac assistance during the arrhythmia, allowing for the maintenance of cardiac output and the minimization of defibrillation thresholds.

• The text describes an accommodating intraocular lens (IOL) device with two lens portions: a first lens for accommodative power and a second base lens for corrective refractive power.
• The first lens is elastically deformable and filled with a fluid or gel, while the second base lens is rigid and configured to not readily deform.
• The transfer of radially compressive forces onto the lens chamber is accomplished by features such as reduced thickness opposing sides, a hinge, lower Young's modulus material, or a substantially rigid base lens.
• An IOL device is provided with a first lens having a biconvex shape, a fully enclosed cavity, and a gel with a refractive index of 1.46 or greater and a Young's modulus of 10 psi or less.
• The second lens is a plano-convex, bi-convex, or positive meniscus lens, and is substantially more rigid than the first lens.
• The IOL further comprises a hinge disposed between the circumferential haptic and the second lens, directing compressive forces onto the first lens for greater proportionate reduction.
• Each opposing and deformable surface of the first lens has a thickness that is 50% or less of the second lens, and the IOL may have apertures and troughs to facilitate fluid flow.
• The IOL device may be made of materials with different Young's moduli, with the base lens having a higher modulus than the lens chamber, or the first lens having a lower modulus than the base lens.

• The present invention relates to a blender container with a metal lining to shield the inner wall and grind fibers.
• In the past, blender containers were made of glass, which required glass break detectors due to expansion and contraction.
• Reinforced plastic containers were later used, but they developed nicks and debris that could contaminate the liquid.
• The inventors solved this problem by adding a metal lining as a shield inside the cup, as described in Patent Document 1.

• The container includes a cup and a rigid lining mounted inside.
• The lining is shaped as a half-mask and combined to the inner wall to form a shield screen with teeth for grinding fibers.
• The lining is made of a rigid material, such as metal, and is an annular member formed integrally as a whole.
• The cup has a handle and spout, and several vertical ribs and stopper members correspond to each other.

• The facets of the rib and stopper member form perpendicular spoilers that dampen vibration and sweep fibers into the whirlpool.
• The teeth on the lining and stopper member grate and chop fibers, reducing the duration for stirring and oxidization of the juice.

• The second embodiment describes a container where the cup and lining are prefabricated and combined to form a whole.
• The lining has prop stands and a horizontal ring for user convenience, and is mounted inside the cup without movements.

• The third embodiment describes a container where the cup and lining are prefabricated and embedded into each other.
• The lining is composed of several lining pieces, and the first facet of the stopper member is bent inward to form a buckled piece that fits into a groove on the rib.

• The fourth embodiment describes a container where the cup and lining are prefabricated and embedded into each other.
• The lining is shaped as a whole mask and has a horizontal ring extended radially outwardly from the top rim for user convenience.
</summary>

* The invention relates to a gravity-driven vehicle, such as a downhill racing cart or sled, with at least two wheels or skis, steering, braking, and suspension systems.
* It is a continuation-in-part of earlier patent applications, claiming the benefit of those applications.
* The vehicle is ridden in a prone, face-down or face-forward position and is designed for use on varied terrain, including dirt, grass, and snow.
* The suspension system is configured to provide precise control in turns, especially when carving on snow.
* The vehicle may have independent mechanical, air actuated, or hydraulic shock absorbers on some or all wheels.
* It may also have a tow bar and rider restraint system for transport and safety.
* The vehicle may be retrofitted with components to create variations, such as a three-wheeled vehicle or a vehicle with a combination of skis and wheels.
* The ski assembly includes a ski brake assembly, with a brake blade that extends below the ski running surface at the ski rear end to engage the terrain surface upon which the ski is running.
* The braking system may be hydraulic, mechanical, or a combination of both, and may be located in the front or rear of the vehicle.
* The vehicle's unique design and geometry provide superior handling, control, and stability in various snow and ice conditions.

• The text describes a study comparing the effects of a copepod oil composition and a concentrated EPA/DHA preparation on atherosclerotic plaque formation and total cholesterol levels in mice.
• The copepod oil composition had a statistically significant ability to inhibit atherosclerotic plaque formation, while the EPA/DHA preparation did not meet the requirements for statistical significance.
• The copepod oil also showed a significant effect on reducing total blood cholesterol levels compared to the EPA/DHA preparation and control diet.
• The copepod oil is derived from a marine copepod, such as Calanus finmarchicus, and contains a high proportion of free fatty acids, low amounts of triglycerides, and high levels of astaxanthin and cholesterol.
• The study highlights the unexpected findings that the copepod oil composition has markedly different biological activities than concentrated EPA/DHA, despite having similar contents of EPA and DHA.

* The garnish pick disclosed includes one or more appendages that can serve as skewering shafts or hooks for securing the pick to a food or beverage container.
* Appendages may project from the main shaft at various angles and orientations, simulating the appearance of an organism or a portion thereof.
* The garnish pick may have two or more appendages, with at least one serving as a hook and at least one as a skewering shaft.
* The garnish pick may be made of various materials, including wood, plastic, rubber, metal, glass, or ceramic, and may have different shapes and sizes.

* The garnish pick can prevent the pick from becoming completely or further submerged in a beverage and make it easier to eat garnishes off the pick without using fingers.
* The garnish pick may have a total length approximately equal to the distance from the rim of a martini glass to the center of the bottom, and a diameter or width diminishing toward the sharp end of the skewering shafts.
* The main shaft and appendages may have various shapes, sizes, and textures, including circular, convolute, ovular, non-circular, square or rectangular, pentagonal, hexagonal, or irregularly shaped cross-sections.
* The garnish pick may have twists and corkscrews that may be expanding or narrowing along a longitudinal axis, and may have sub-appendages that branch from the main appendages.

* The garnish pick may be made of wood or other materials, and may have a first material for the outer coating and a second material for the core.
* The garnish pick may have a pick body with a first elongate body portion, a second elongate body portion branching outward from the first elongate body portion, and a third elongate body portion branching outward from the first elongate body portion.
* The hook formed at the second end of the first elongate body portion may branch outward from the first elongate body portion at an offset location and taper along its length.
* The pick body may be asymmetric about any plane passing through the garnish pick.

* The present disclosure relates to a person support apparatus, such as a hospital or long-term care bed, with a mechanism for adjusting the height and orientation of the patient support frame.
* The patient support deck is supported on a deck support frame, which is provided with a mechanism for adjusting its height and controlling the orientation of the deck relative to the floor.
* The deck support frame is supported on leg assemblies, each having separate and controllable head end and foot end leg assemblies.
* The leg assemblies are pivoted relative to the deck support frame using linear actuators, allowing for separate height adjustment of the foot and head ends.
* Known arrangements for pivoting leg assemblies suffer from problems such as the risk of finger trapping, high frictional forces, and dust and dirt accumulation.
* The present disclosure proposes a solution with an inverted U-shaped channel element having a guide or follower element arranged to contact and run along its inner surface.
* This arrangement results in a deck support frame that is robust and stable, accommodating changes in geometry necessary for movement or adjustment between horizontal, Trendelenburg, and reverse Trendelenburg positions.
* Some embodiments have a lower part count than known systems, are cheaper, and more robust due to fewer parts and reduced frictional forces.
* The opening of the channel carrying the guide elements faces the floor, reducing the likelihood of dirt entering and interfering with the mechanism.
* The use of rollers instead of sliding elements reduces frictional forces and makes the mechanism less likely to fail.

</summary>

• The invention describes an electro-surgical dissecting and cauterizing instrument for use in laparoscopic procedures, which includes a rigid arm extending from the sleeve to the working tip electrode.
• The arm is laterally offset from the longitudinal axis of the sleeve, reducing obstruction of the surgeon's view of the working tip electrode and surgical work site.
• The instrument includes an electrical insulating layer along the entire length of the tool up to the exposed working tip electrode, eliminating inadvertent cauterization of healthy tissue.
• The instrument is designed for easy handling and use in endoscopic procedures and comes in various working tip electrode configurations, such as a hook and flattened spatula.
• The arm extends from the sleeve and includes portions laterally offset from the main axis of the sleeve, providing maximum visualization of the working tip electrode and operation site.
• The invention includes three embodiments of the electro-surgical instrument, each with a different arm configuration and working tip electrode shape, allowing for various surgical applications.

* The present invention relates to pelvic floor reconstruction using implants, specifically addressing the issue of reliable anchoring of mesh implants during surgery.
* Pelvic organ prolapse (POP) is a common condition affecting women, causing organs in the pelvic cavity to shift out of position. Surgical reconstruction is performed through the vagina, using synthetic non-absorbable polypropylene mesh implants.
* Prior art surgical procedures have limitations, including penetrating the patient from multiple directions and not providing reliable anchoring of the mesh implant.
* The invention introduces a needle for surgical threading of a strap of an implant through a tissue, featuring a trap for trapping the strap, a tip for threading it, and a mechanism for releasing the trap while allowing return of the tip to the accessible side.
* The anterior implant includes straps threaded into the arcus tendineous fascia pelvic (ATFP) ligaments and sacrospinous (SS) ligaments, with a loop between the second straps anchored to the cervix for use in reconstructing organs such as the urinary bladder, colon, and small intestine.
* The posterior implant includes straps threaded into the sacrospinous ligaments, with a first loop anchored to the cervix and a second loop anchored to the perineal body for use in reconstructing organs such as the colon, small intestine, and uterus. The methods for using the needle and installing the anterior and posterior implants are also described.

- The text also describes methods for determining the particle size and yield of the microparticles, as well as release tests for albumin, tetracycline, and daunorubicin.
- The invention provides a versatile platform for developing pharmaceutical compositions with controlled release properties and improved therapeutic efficacy.

* The invention described is a golf ball teeing device that allows a golfer to easily tee up a ball without bending over, using a golf club as a handle.
* The device consists of a housing with a delayed urging means that secures the ball and tee in place when the tee is pushed into the ground, automatically releasing them once the tee is fully inserted.
* The device is lightweight, portable, and requires few parts, making it small enough to carry in a golf bag and easy to use without the need for cumbersome controls.
* The invention also allows for easy retrieval of the golf tee, whether it remains in the ground or comes out while hitting the ball, without bending over or using a large, heavy device.
* The device is made from a flexible plastic material and can be easily attached to a golf club grip or clipped to a pocket or belt for convenience.
* The delayed urging means, which can be made from low-recovery foam or other materials, ensures that the ball and tee are securely held in place during the teeing process.
* The housing, interface member, and delayed urging means have specific dimensions that allow for successful operation of the device.
* The annular wall and taper of the device provide clearance for golf club grips and ensure proper alignment with the axis of the golf club.
* The gripping fingers, which are capable of flexing outward, prevent the device from becoming skewed with respect to the axis of the golf club.
* The supporting ribs provide strength to the annular wall and taper, ensuring that the material does not fracture during insertion of a golf club grip.
* The clip allows the device to be easily clipped to a golf bag, pocket, or belt for convenience and portability.
* The invention eliminates the need for a manually controlled unclamping mechanism, making it simpler and more efficient than prior tee setting devices.
* The invention can be made from a variety of materials and can have different dimensions and shapes while still achieving the desired function.
* The invention has the additional advantages of being easy to use, nonintrusive, and able to be made from fewer parts than prior tee setting devices.
* The invention allows for both teeing up a ball and retrieving a tee without bending over, making it a convenient and practical solution for golfers.

* The present invention relates to a new type of fastener for albums with removable pages.
* It uses a pair of strap anchors, one for each cover, and a strap that passes through aligned apertures in the covers and pages.
* The strap is snap-locked into each channel-shaped anchor, preventing longitudinal displacement.
* Each anchor has two or more pairs of locking lips to provide a more positive locking system.
* The strap enters the channel via an aperture bordered by a projection that ensures correct location between the strap anchor and the cover.
* The album can have at least two of these fasteners mounted along the spine part.
* The strap anchors can be adhesively attached to the covers.
* The simple design allows for easy insertion and removal of pages, and the strap's length accommodates variable thicknesses of the album.

• The present invention relates to a magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) apparatus with a magnet, patient receptacle, support plate, and transmit and receive coils for exposures in two predetermined positions.
• In known MRI apparatuses, exposure parameters must be modified for different exposure positions, requiring adjustments to optimize the RF chain and homogeneity of the main magnetic field.
• These adjustments can take 10 to 90 seconds per exposure position, making it difficult to track contrast agent doses over larger body regions without a smaller viewing field or multiple injections.
• The inventive MRI apparatus determines required adjustment parameters in a preceding adjustment process and executes exposures in a subsequent exposure process.
• Adjustment parameters can be modified by spatial positioning of the support plate or connection/disconnection of transmit and receive coils.
• The adjustment parameters are stored until the conclusion of the examination and can be used again for identical or similar exposure parameters.
• High-contrast exposures are obtained without omitting adjustments, and reduced examination times result due to the ability to quickly switch transmit and receive coils.
• The inventive solution is suitable for various forms of MRI apparatuses, including cylindrical and horseshoe magnets.
</summary>

* The present invention relates to a skin reflectance measuring apparatus.
* Skin reflectance is useful in pathology and cosmetology for studying seborrhea and testing anti-reflectance products.
* Known methods for measuring surface reflectance are not suitable for skin due to the influence of color and the need for accurate positioning.
* The invention proposes a reflectance measurement apparatus specifically adapted for measuring skin reflectance.

* The apparatus comprises a probe with an aperture, a flexible connection in fiber optics, and a measuring device with light emitting and receiving means and processing means.
* The probe is small, flexible, and can be easily positioned on the skin without requiring high accuracy.
* The measuring device uses a relative measurement between specular and diffuse reflection to compensate for color influence.
* The apparatus can tolerate a few degrees of deviation of relative position between the probe and the skin surface.
* The correction of variations in light intensity and ambient light makes it possible to obtain accurate measurements without strict operational conditions.
* The resulting reflectance is a relative value, which can be displayed immediately to help in correctly positioning the probe and can be used to evaluate skin conditions.

* The emitting device regulates the intensity of the emitted light, and the receiving device measures both specular and diffuse reflection.
* The processing device uses digital processing means to control the course of measurements and process the results, and the display device shows the reflectance value.
* The miniaturization of the probe and its flexible connection with the rest of the apparatus allow for ready handling and taking measurements over different areas of the skin surface.
* The use of a logarithmic amplifier in the receiving device procures greater dynamics and makes the measuring apparatus closer to the visual judgement required.
* The receiving device measures the reflectance according to the synchronous detection principle by alternately controlling the switching on and off of the light source.
* The quantities ΦSs, ΦDs, K, and SC are determined by calibration, and their values are stored in the memory circuits of the micro-computer.
* The measuring and calibrating operations use programmes to initialize the system, record on file, and read out information.
* The measuring operation consists of initializing the graph, positioning the cursor, scanning the keyboard

- The invention described herein is a dental cleaning and massaging apparatus that provides hydraulic cleaning of teeth and massaging of gums.
- Research shows that brushing alone is not adequate for preventing caries and peridental disease, so hydro-therapy devices have been developed to address this need.
- The apparatus consists of a mouthpiece with upper and lower channel members, joined by membranes and pneumatic means for massaging gums.
- Hydraulic means are also provided for cleaning teeth and gingival crevices and lubricating gums during massaging.
- The mouthpiece fits over the teeth and snugly against the gums, with holes for fluid flow and bite blocks to hold the teeth in place.

</summary>

<summary>

- The upper and lower channel members are made of a relatively soft but semi-rigid material and are designed to fit over the upper and lower teeth, respectively.
- A first outer membrane extends from the upper to lower channel members, and a second inner membrane extends from the uppermost to lowermost parts of the channel members.
- The area between the uppermost part of the upper channel member and the lowermost part of the lower channel member is enclosed by the membranes, forming a sealed area.
- A plurality of bite blocks are located in both upper and lower channel members, with each structure consisting of a bite block, post or rod, block, and hole.
- A hose or tube is positioned between the bottom of the upper channel member and the top of the lower channel member, with air-sacks integrated along the tube for inflation.

</summary>

<summary>

- The hose or tube is threaded through holes in the bite blocks and secured to the channel members by a suitable adhesive.
- A coupler is secured to the hose or tube and passes through the outer membrane, with another hose or tube secured to the outside of the membrane and connected to the coupler.
- A hose or tube is located in the area formed by the membranes, with one end extending through the inner membrane and the other end secured to a coupler.
- Couplers are secured to the membrane and provided with seals to ensure a fluid-tight seal between the membrane and the coupler.

• The invention relates to methods and apparatus for providing ventilatory assistance matched to a subject's respiratory needs, suitable for spontaneously or non-spontaneously breathing human subjects.
• Subjects with severe lung, chest wall, neuromuscular, or respiratory control diseases may require long-term home mechanical ventilation, especially during sleep.
• During sleep, there are changes in neural control of breathing and mechanics of the subject's airways, respiratory muscles, and chest wall, requiring increased ventilatory support.
• Most simple home ventilators fail to meet the goals of closely matching the subject's respiratory phase, adjusting the degree of assistance to maintain a minimum ventilation, and continuing to work correctly in the presence of large leaks.
• Servo-ventilators can maintain ventilation at or above a specified level but fail to closely match the subject's respiratory phase.
• Proportional assist ventilation (PAV) tailors the pressure vs. time profile within a breath to partially or completely unload the subject's resistive and elastic work, but it relies on the subject's chemoreceptor reflexes and fails to meet the goals of adjusting the depth of assistance and providing immunity to leaks.
• The invention seeks to achieve goals (i), (ii), and (iii) simultaneously by determining the instantaneous phase in the respiratory cycle as a continuous variable, calculating the instantaneous phase from prototype flow-vs.-time waveforms, and providing ventilatory assistance based on the determined phase.
• The method involves selecting at least two identifiable features of a prototype flow-vs.-time waveform, determining the phase for each feature, assigning a weight to each phase, defining fuzzy sets for magnitude and rate of change, and applying fuzzy inference rules to determine the instantaneous phase.
• The method also includes calculating leak-corrected respiratory airflow, measuring the instantaneous phase, and applying defuzzification procedures to determine the instantaneous phase and average respiratory rate.
• The invention further discloses methods for calculating instantaneous phase, measuring average respiratory rate, and providing ventilatory assistance in a spontaneously breathing subject, including determining the extent that the subject is adequately ventilated and setting mask pressure as a function of the phase.

* The present invention relates to a ventilation system for rotating water feeds in water-cooled generators, addressing the issue of air bubbles accumulating at the point of lowest pressure (axis of rotation) and obstructing cooling efficiency.
* The invention provides at least one bypass with inlets and outlets between the feed and discharge ducts, allowing bubbles to be rapidly and completely removed using the pressure gradient.
* The bypass can be arranged in or on the end face of feed ducts, or as a coiled pipe with an inlet in the space around the axis of rotation.
* The bypass can be designed with means to increase hydrodynamic resistance, enabling an adequate pressure drop over a short distance and smaller outer dimensions for the ventilation system.
* The invention solves the problem of air bubbles accumulating at the axis of rotation, improving cooling efficiency and reducing the negative consequences of overheating.
* The invention offers a simple and effective solution for the automatic removal of air or gas bubbles in rotating pipes, such as water feeds of water-cooled generators.

* The invention relates to a steering column for motor vehicles with a jacket unit supporting a steering shaft and a retaining part secured non-displaceably to the jacket unit up to a limit value of force. The jacket unit is displaceable with respect to the retaining part upon exceeding the limit value, with energy absorption connections including bending wires or strips.
* The invention also includes a method for producing such a steering column, as well as adjustable and non-adjustable steering column designs disclosed in related patents and applications.
* The invention addresses the problem of decreasing the force peak during the break-away of the jacket unit from the retaining part by exerting an elastic prestress on the bending wires or strips, resulting in a simpler and cost-effective implementation while maintaining a stable connection in normal driving operation.

* The invention provides an apparatus for removing a gas from a liquid, including a vessel with partitions dividing it into gasification chambers, mechanisms for ingesting and mixing a second gas into each chamber, and vents for removing gas and liquid.
* The apparatus is particularly suited for use on floating offshore hydrocarbon recovery platforms and has a reduced height compared to stripping towers, allowing for lower capital costs.
* Each gasification chamber has a vapor space above the liquid level, and mechanisms for ingesting and mixing a second gas displace the first gas to the vapor space, where it is removed by a vent.
* The second gas, such as nitrogen, physically displaces the first gas, allowing for the scavenging of oxygen from the water without the need for chemical scavengers in most cases.

* The invention describes a power and free conveyor system with selectively operable second and third dogs for transferring carriers across short or long distances.
* The second and third dogs include cam projections that engage portions of the track, allowing one or the other to be moved to operative position as the carrier approaches a transfer zone.
* The system minimizes time and cost for transfer while accommodating various systems with varying transfer distances.

* The invention involves a hydraulic unit with a housing block and a motor, where pressure fluid entrained by the piston pumps drips into spring chambers, preventing the need for permeable elements or check valves at a central venting point.
* The design allows for economic production by utilizing conduit portions in dual ways, forming a pressure equalization conduit between the spring chambers and the motor interior.
* The invention also ensures a pressure equilibrium between the motor and a covering hood, protecting electromagnets and other electrically operative components from the harmful effects of the environment.

• The document describes a packaging machine with a shaft arranged in the production direction, which drives movable tool members of various work stations through transfer mechanisms.
• The shaft's rotational movement is converted into the movement required to operate the respective tool member, ensuring synchronized movements.
• The transfer mechanism can be an arrangement of toggle levers or a cam mechanism, rendering it robust and independent of high wear components.
• The shaft only requires comparatively little installation space, allowing for a compact structural design.
• The packaging machine may have a frame to stabilize the shaft and prevent vibrations, ensuring precision in the packaging process.
• A tool member on a work station can be displaced in the production direction by the shaft, enabling easy adaptation to varying conditions.
• Two transfer mechanisms may be provided for converting the movement of the shaft into the movement of a tool member of a work station, ensuring uniform driving forces.
• The document also discusses alternative embodiments, modifications, and additional features of the packaging machine.

• The invention provides a vehicle rearview mirror system that is tolerant of different protocols of an output from a vehicle control. The system includes a mirror control responsive to the output of the vehicle control, which determines the protocol and generates a mirror control output.
• The mirror control may be a microcomputer that determines the protocol by software processing and monitors the output of the vehicle control. The output may be gear status information, engine information, alarm information, or door status information. The mirror control establishes a value for the drive signal based on the output and the protocol, and controls a lighting assembly associated with the mirror assemblies.

• The present invention relates to a disposable finishing article with a permanently affixed mounting hub.
• The grinding wheel is placed in compression during use, ensuring a secure attachment to the power tool spindle.
• A backing flange with gripping means and a retaining nut with a radial flange and protrusion are used to secure the flange and nut together on the finishing article.
• The retaining nut extends through the finishing article and is secured by upsetting the end to create a protrusion that engages the backing flange.
• A pressure cap is held in place by the gripping means on the backing flange and extends to engage the power tool spindle seat.
• The pressure cap may be easily snapped into place before use or during assembly in the factory.
• The force necessary to compress the grinding wheel is generated upon attachment of the spindle to the threads in the nut.
• The structures as illustrated and described require no adhesive for construction and accommodate all standard sizes of depressed center grinding wheels.
• The grinding wheel assemblies are smooth in operation, light in weight, and less expensive than prior art throw-away articles while meeting all safety standards.

• The invention provides a gate valve for controlling bulk dispensing of viscous substances, mounted on the spout of a bag or pouch.
• It includes a tubular sleeve with a dispensing passage and a curved gate carried by a guide.
• The gate is reciprocated by engagement with fingers, drawing into sealing engagement with the outlet as it moves over it.
• The gate and guide are curved complementally transversely for effective sealing and variable flow.
• The valve assembly is removably mounted on the spout of a bag in a dispenser, with a tapered sleeve and annular sealing ribs.
• The gate valve member comprises a plate with channel-formations and an integral upward guide and operating channel-like extension.
• The gate valve member is reciprocated on the guide member by means of the extension and stop lugs.
• The valve can be actuated with one hand, providing complete cut-off and effective seal, and can function in inclined position.
• The valve is readily disassemble for cleaning and easily reassemble by reversing the procedure.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a new design of a sulky, which can be manufactured using lightweight and durable materials like aluminum and reinforced plastics.
• The sulky's design allows for easy assembly by the user, using flat elements that require minimal space during storage and transportation.
• The sulky's frame is built using inexpensive semi-produced components, such as casted elements and extruded profiles.
• The sulky's stable construction transfers the load to the wheel planes only, ensuring a reliable and efficient design.
• The sulky can be assembled using ordinary hand tools, with all connections becoming secure and without any play, even with manufacturing tolerances.
• The new design results in a weight reduction of approximately 40% for the complete sulky, which has a total weight of approximately 18 kg in a ready-to-use state.
• The sulky can be easily colored by applying color tapes in all recesses of the profiles, providing an inexpensive and individual color display system.
• The sulky's end frames are casted using a chill-casting or press-casting process, while the crossbar is manufactured using extruded aluminum or a similar light metal.
</summary>

• The sulky's wheels and shafts are mounted to the end frames, with the driver's seat arranged centrally on the crossbar, which is fastened to the mounting bushings in the end frames.
• The end frames are shaped so that all wheel-fastening, shaft-fastening, and crossbar-fastening devices are arranged in the same vertical plane, ensuring a best possible load situation.
• The end frames are arranged symmetrically related to the plane of the wheels, leading to a stable construction of the sulky that differs from conventional solutions.
• The crossbar is adapted to the mounting bushings and may be fastened thereto using extruded brackets and conventional clamping devices.
• The crossbar is designed as an extruded aluminum profile with closed cross section and internal extending protrusions, with strengthening elements arranged on diametrically opposite faces.
• The strengthening elements are shifted along the aluminum profile to a suitable place, allowing the threaded holes to coincide with the assembling recesses in the profile and the mounting bushing.

* The present invention introduces an anti-dive unit with a damped telescopic front suspension to an anti-lock braking system for motorcycles. This unit responds to the brake force applied to the front wheel and prevents the front fork from diving, reducing the decrease in braking efficiency.
* The anti-dive unit consists of a housing, a valve body, a valve seat, and a valve spring. It is provided on the front surface of the lower portion of each telescopic fork or the bottom case. When the front master cylinder operates to actuate the front wheel brake, the valve body is set on the valve seat, and the valve chamber is closed or limitedly opened, stopping or greatly limiting the passage of oil, resulting in a great damping force. Conversely, when the front fork starts extending, the oil in the reserve oil chamber flows to open the check valve and enter the lower hydraulic chamber with a comparatively low pressure, causing the damping force to occur in the anti-dive unit, and the front fork extends substantially in the same manner as in the case where the master cylinder is not in operation.

* The pallet system includes a pallet with raised parallel guide rails and end plates, which help secure and interlock trays, and restrict lateral and longitudinal movement.
* The pallet system allows trays to be slid on and off, and is suitable for automated loading and unloading, while providing enhanced stability and rigidity when loaded and wrapped.
* The pallet cap and end plates can be made of plastic and manufactured using various methods, with customized features for specific loads, such as egg trays.
* The pallet system can be customized in various ways, including the size and shape of the pallet, the number and position of guide rails and pockets, and the design of end stops and plates.

• The text describes a railroad car center plate assembly and a grounding product for its all-polymeric type bowl liners.
• Early railroad car liners were made of hard metal alloys like manganese steel, requiring frequent lubrication. More recent liners are made of ultra high molecular weight polymer, eliminating the need for lubrication but requiring separate grounding apparatus.
• The present invention provides for effective grounding without the use of conductive plates, clips, or shunts attached to the liner. The liner material used is similar to that disclosed in Chierici and Murphy patents but has improved electrical properties.
• The Chierici and Murphy patent discloses a special truck bolster bowl liner made of an ultra high molecular weight polymer, which eliminates the need for lubrication but requires grounding due to its electrically insulating nature.
• The present invention uses a liner composed of a base UHMW-PE material with a conductive material additive, such as carbon black, to make the liner conductive and eliminate the need for additional grounding apparatus.
• The liner is pliable but non-stretchable, compaction resistant, and has a high degree of elastic memory. It is also designed to fully fill the space between the truck bolster bowl and the body bolster center plate, limiting lost motion movement and providing vertical support.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a process for installing flat uncontoured glass in curved window openings of vehicles.
• Objective is to provide an economical and inexpensive method for installing curved glass windows.
• Conventional method uses pre-contoured glass, which is expensive and brittle.
• Flat glass is less rigid and more flexible, making it safer and less expensive.
• Glass is flexed in situ to conform to the curved window opening.
• Fastening means includes resilient clips and a reveal molding.
• Reveal molding is held in place by clips, pressing on the outer surface of the glass.
• Lower end of molding acts as a securing element, effecting and maintaining flexure of the glass.
• Adhesive sealant is applied after glass is flexed, allowing for clearance and proper placement.
• Dam of elastic material is used to hold the glass in place until adhesive cures, setting the glass permanently.
</summary>

• The present invention is a process for installing flat uncontoured glass in curved window openings of vehicles.
• Objective is to provide an economical and inexpensive method for installing curved glass windows.
• Conventional method uses pre-contoured glass, which is expensive and brittle.
• Flat glass is less rigid and more flexible, making it safer and less expensive.
• Glass is flexed in situ to conform to the curved window opening.
• Fastening means includes resilient clips and a reveal molding.
• Reveal molding is held in place by clips, pressing on the outer surface of the glass.
• Lower end of molding acts as a securing element, effecting and maintaining flexure of the glass.
• Adhesive sealant is applied after glass is flexed, allowing for clearance and proper placement.
• Dam of elastic material is used to hold the glass in place until adhesive cures, setting the glass permanently.

• The present invention addresses the disadvantages of the conventional method for installing curved glass windows.
• Conventional method uses expensive, pre-contoured glass that becomes brittle and less flexible.
• Flat glass is less expensive, more flexible, and safer in the event of a

• The text describes an invention related to a sanitizable rotary valve for use in liquid chromatography systems, specifically for separating and purifying biological macromolecules in the pharmaceutical industry.
• Prior art rotary valves, such as those in U.S. Pat. Nos. 4,808,317, 2,985,589, 3,268,604, and 4,409,033, have no sanitizable features and require disassembly for cleaning.
• The invention includes a rotary carousel diaphragm valve with a thermoplastic elastomeric diaphragm that forms multiple sealing ports and sanitary elastomeric tubular ducts.
• The valve has a flexible wiping lip seal that maintains fluid-tight sealing engagement with the stator even when the rotor is moved orthogonally for cross flushing.
• The invention also includes a process for forming a rotary valve diaphragm seal in place using insert molding, and the objective is to provide a sanitizable slider valve with intermittent flushing and cleaning capabilities while maintaining the sterile condition of the process system.

• The present invention concerns streptavidin muteins with improved binding affinity for peptide ligands, produced through mutations in the region of amino acid positions 44 to 53 of wild type streptavidin.
• Two specific streptavidin muteins, Val44ThrAla46Arg and Ile44GlyAla46Arg, were identified through a screening process using a PhoA/strep-tag II fusion protein. They showed increased binding affinity compared to wild type streptavidin.
• The invention also includes methods for producing, purifying, and using these streptavidin muteins, as well as a reagent kit containing the muteins for use in various applications.

<summary>

* The present invention relates to movable partitions and bulkheads for separating or insulating cargo during transportation or storage.
* Refrigerated trailers, railcars, and containers are typically configured with a single, large cargo space, leading to unnecessary cooling and increased costs.
* Movable partitions and bulkheads have been used to divide cargo areas for multi-temperature transport.
* The invention includes an improved partition system with independently movable panels.

* In a preferred embodiment, two bulkheads or panels are slidably attached to separate pairs of ceiling-mounted rails, allowing for the definition of multiple cargo areas.
* The panels can be raised and lowered to stow them when not in use.
* The panel, trolley assembly, and rail system can be implemented in various configurations.
* The rails may be installed on the side walls of the trailer, enabling the panels to open like a standard household door.
* The mounting assembly can be replaced with any mechanism that permits rotational, slideable, or hinged movement between the rails and the bulkhead.
* The panels are moved by lifting them up and to the rear of the trailer, and are secured to the ceiling when not in use.

* The panels can be used without center partition panels and can be easily separated from one another.
* The panels can be secured relative to one another with cooperating straps and buckles or channels, grooves, flanges, polymeric seals, or locking pins.
* The invention includes a variety of additional modifications without departing from the spirit and scope of the invention.
</summary>

* The present invention relates to gas-liquid contacting trays and improvements in valve-tray assemblies. One aspect includes an improved tray valve assembly for a process column, where liquid flows downwardly from a downcomer onto a tray and thereacross in a first direction upon the active area, and vapor flows upwardly for interaction and mass transfer.
* The improvement comprises a plurality of apertures formed in the tray having a valve cover mounted thereon. The valve cover is mounted by first and second legs, the first leg being disposed to intercept the flow of liquid across the tray and being wider than the second leg. The legs are mounted to the tray in outwardly slotted portions thereof for defining the orientation of the valve relative to the liquid flow.
* The invention also includes the above described tray valve being formed of a round disc having the first and second legs depending downwardly therefrom. Each of the legs are formed with outwardly extending flange portions for underlying the tray and locking the disc in a floating relationship relative thereto.
* The valve aperture is circular in shape and the valve legs are disposed in slotted regions disposed outwardly of the circular aperture to prevent the rotation of the valve plate for maintaining the orientation of the valve leg relative to the tray. The biasing means comprises a detent portion formed on the cover of the valve for preventing the surface thereof from resting flush against the tray surface, facilitating the initial passage of vapor through the valve.

* The text describes an electrical driven flying saucer based on magnetic suspension, which includes a saucer shell, a saucer cabin, a rotary-wing system, and a control system. The rotary-wing system is a magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing system with magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels suspended on a magnetic suspension shaft.
* The text also discusses the design of radial and axial magnetic suspension structures for the magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels, which use repulsive forces between magnets to suspend the wheels in the radial and axial directions.
* The electric engine of the flying saucer is formed by the magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels, the electromotive ring, and the magnetic suspension shaft, which generate a rotating magnetic field and push the rotor to rotate.
* The text proposes two improvements for the rotary-wing system: coaxial axial dual magnetic suspension electromotive rotary wings and coaxial radial dual magnetic suspension electromotive rotary wings, which help overcome reactive torque and enhance the power performance of the flying saucer.

• The invention relates to methods of forming substituted guanidines using nickel catalysts.
• Preferred methods involve reacting guanylating agents with amines or pyrrolidines in the presence of nickel catalysts.
• Nickel catalysts are preferably in the zero oxidation state and derived from nickel-boride alloys, nickel-phosphide alloys, aluminum-nickel alloys, nickel on kieselguhr, and nickel on silica/alumina.
• Suitable guanylating agents are thioureas and isothioureas, with at least one R group being a protecting group.
• The inventive methods provide high yields of substituted guanidines with minimal quantities of reagents and under mild reaction conditions.

* The present invention describes a process for producing transgenic plants or plant cells transformed on a chromosome with a DNA sequence of interest, capable of expressing a function of interest.
* The process involves providing plant cells or plants with at least two different vectors, which are adapted to recombine with each other by site-specific recombination and integrate the DNA sequence of interest into the chromosome.
* The DNA sequence of interest contains sequence portions from both vectors, which are necessary for expressing the function of interest.
* The process allows for efficient, rapid, and highly versatile transformation, enabling the assembly of complex DNA sequences in planta and reducing cloning work and overall vector sizes. Additionally, it allows for the production of transgenic plants with all coding sequences and expressible sequences of the sequence of interest being of plant origin.

• The invention describes a white, flame-retardant, UV-resistant, thermoformable, oriented film made from a crystallizable thermoplastic with good optical and mechanical properties, and can be produced cost-effectively.
• The film comprises at least one white pigment, at least one flame retardant, and at least one UV absorber, and has excellent orientability, thermoformability, and passes fire and UV resistance tests.

<summary>

- The present invention relates to a fluid pressure regulator assembly that generates power while regulating fluid pressure.
- It reduces variances in output pressure caused by large differences in input pressure and is inexpensive, lightweight, and portable.
- The assembly includes a pressurized fluid source, high-pressure and transfer lines, a fluid regulator, and a vane motor with a generator.
- The vane motor converts fluid pressure into mechanical power, which is then converted into electrical energy by the generator.
- The fluid regulator is a standard type, regulating pressure by opening and closing a valve in response to changes in fluid pressure.
- The vane motor is a vane type, with a drive shaft, casing, inner drum, and vanes that rotate when fluid pressure is applied.
- The assembly can be used in various applications, such as gas grills, underwater breathing apparatuses, and vehicles, to recover work from pressurized fluids.

</summary>

The present invention is a fluid pressure regulator assembly that generates power while regulating fluid pressure. It reduces variances in output pressure caused by large differences in input pressure and is inexpensive, lightweight, and portable. The assembly includes a pressurized fluid source, high-pressure and transfer lines, a fluid regulator, and a vane motor with a generator. The vane motor converts fluid pressure into mechanical power, which is then converted into electrical energy by the generator. The fluid regulator is a standard type, regulating pressure by opening and closing a valve in response to changes in fluid pressure. The vane motor is a vane type, with a drive shaft, casing, inner drum, and vanes that rotate when fluid pressure is applied. The assembly can be used in various applications, such as gas grills, underwater breathing apparatuses, and vehicles, to recover work from pressurized fluids.

• The present invention provides a method and apparatus for inserting different weft threads in a multiple-color air jet loom, allowing stable insertion of various kinds of weft threads with suitable weft carrying forces.
• Different weft carrying forces are produced by subnozzles with different orifices or by supplying air under different pressures to the subnozzles.
• The weft insertion apparatus includes a control system that generates weft selection and on-off command signals to regulate air pressure and timing for inserting and carrying weft threads.
• The arrangement ensures efficient use of pressurized air and reduces the occurrence of weft insertion failures, resulting in stabilized weft insertion.

* The present invention relates to a process for spinning bast fibres, including health preserving, opening, cleaning, carding, and spinning steps, to produce bast fibre yarn with low end breakage rate.
* The process involves health preserving bast fibre strips under specific temperature, humidity, and duration conditions to improve their flexibility and spinnability.
* The invention also covers a process for blended spinning bast fibres and other fibres, which adopts the same health preservation technique to produce multi-fibre yarn with improved work efficiency and product quality.

<summary>

- The text describes an invention for forming fiber mixtures from multiple fiber types by sequentially removing partial quantities from individual fiber bales.
- The method eliminates disadvantages of previous methods, such as fiber residuals and lack of homogeneity.
- The method involves measuring the entire momentary quantity of each fiber bale before each pass and determining a partial quantity corresponding to a predetermined proportion.
- Only the calculated partial quantity is removed from each fiber bale during the pass, ensuring no residuals remain.
- The method can be adapted to maintain a determined time schedule for fiber removal and ensure a uniform supply to after-connected processing machines.
- The apparatus for performing the method includes a bale opener, quantity measuring device, and control device.

</summary>

<summary>

* The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for continuously electrolytically coloring aluminum strips or wires.
* The invention aims to provide a method for forming a colored anodic coating on aluminum with excellent weatherability or fade resistance without requiring a large amount of electrical energy.
* The method involves anodizing aluminum in an anodic oxidation bath and then electrolytically coloring the oxide coating in an electrolytic coloring bath.
* The anodic oxidation bath contains sulfuric acid and may include other additives.
* The thickness of the oxide film formed in the anodic oxidation bath should be thicker than 4 microns for effective coloring.
* The electrolytic coloring bath contains at least one of a nickel salt, a cobalt salt, a copper salt, a tin salt, and selenious acid.
* The color obtained depends on the bath composition and electrolytic conditions.
* The aluminum strip or wire functions as a cathode in the electrolytic coloring bath and is electrolyzed by direct current.
* The current density and electrolytic period of time in the bath are controlled by the area of the aluminum strip or wire, the amount of electric current applied, and the period of immersion.
* The apparatus includes a means for continuously supplying an aluminum strip or wire, an anodic oxidation bath, an electrolytic coloring bath, an electric circuit, and a means for passing the aluminum strip or wire through the baths.

</summary>

* The present invention relates to a swash plate type compressor with a fluorocarbon coating on the swash plate to reduce frictional wear and increase durability.
* Swash plate compressors have a swash plate that rotates and contacts piston shoes, causing shear-type friction and wear.
* Prior art includes electroplated metal matrix coatings with fluororesin, but these coatings have limitations such as high cost, complex process, and susceptibility to rapid abrasion.
* The present invention uses a heat curable, cross-linked coating of a polyfluoro elastomer directly bonded to the aluminum swash plate.
* The coating includes lubricious and load bearing additives to provide both durability and low coefficient of friction.
* The coating is applied as a spray and cured in an oven, allowing for simultaneous coating of the swash plate facial surfaces and end surface.
* The piston shoe can also be coated with the fluorocarbon coating for additional low friction properties.
* The coating process does not require high surface finishing or expensive base materials, making it more cost-effective and accessible.
* The coating exhibits high seizure loads and low friction coefficients in testing, outperforming uncoated and tin-coated swash plates.
* The invention is applicable to non-hypereutectic aluminum and aluminum alloys, eliminating the need for hypereutectic base materials or metal coatings.

* The present invention provides novel organic polymers suitable for use in anti-reflective coatings for semiconductor devices, specifically for use in photolithography processes using 193 nm and 248 nm light beams. These polymers are designed to absorb light strongly at these wavelengths to prevent standing waves and reflection.
* The polymers can be prepared using reaction equations involving polyhydroxystyrene resin, diazonaphthoquinone halide, and an amine in a solvent. The resulting polymers form a cross-linked structure when hard-baked, allowing for the formation of a spectroscopically stable organic anti-reflective coating material. Examples of polymer synthesis include copolymers of polyhydroxystyrene, poly(hydroxy-methylstyrene), poly(hydroxystyrene-hydroxyethylacrylate), poly(hydroxystyrene-hydroxyethylmethacrylate), phenylnovolac, and cresolnovolac. These polymers have been proven to be effective organic anti-reflective coating materials in the formation of submicro-patterns using 248 nm KrF and 193 nm ArF lasers, as well as with E-beam, EUV, and ion beam light sources.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics with yarns in at least two layers laid at an angle to the long axis of the fabric.
• Traditional knitted or woven fabrics cannot provide sufficient strength for structural uses, leading to the development of non-woven fabrics.
• The most desirable non-woven fabrics for structural purposes have at least two layers with yarns at approximately 45° to the long axis, lying at 90° to each other.
• The present invention uses a rake mechanism synchronized with, but driven separately from, the conveyors, yarn carrying means, and bonding mechanism to achieve greater assurance of parallelism of the yarns.
• The rake mechanism allows successive courses of yarn to overlap, improving control of strength and thickness of the resulting layer, with overlapping portions parallel to the first courses.
• The apparatus and process have been sought for their greater control of strength and uniformity, and the present invention fulfills this need by using a rake mechanism with needles formed at angles corresponding to the approaching yarns.
</summary>

• The text describes an improved process for the deacylation and desulfurization of a compound having the formula: ##STR3## using hypophosphorous acid.
• Pyrazolotriazoles, which are useful magenta couplers for photographic products, are difficult to synthesize and have a complex synthesis process.
• The most common method for desulfurization involves a ring contraction reaction followed by hydrolysis and desulfurization with hydrochloric acid.
• However, this method generates significant amounts of unwanted impurities, including thione and disulfide, which can interfere with subsequent reaction steps and are detrimental in photographic systems.
• The use of hypophosphorous acid in the deacylation and desulfurization step reduces the amount of these impurities and increases the yield of the desired product.
• The process also has other advantages, such as the formation of H2S instead of sulfur, which is readily removed, and the lack of reduction of nitro groups or other functional groups in the molecule.
• The process can be used to prepare a 3,6-disubstituted-1H-pyrazolo[5,1-c]-1,2,4-triazole from an acylated compound using an acylation reaction followed by deacylation and desulfurization.
• The acylation reaction can be conducted at any convenient temperature and in the presence of a catalytic quantity of a Bronsted or Lewis acid.
• The deacylation and desulfurization reaction is generally conducted using hydrochloric or hydrobromic acid and hypophosphorous acid, and the reaction time is dependent on the reaction temperature and inherent reactivity of the reactants.
• The desired pyrazolotriazole can be isolated from the reaction mixture by a known technique such as extraction.
• The invention has been described with reference to preferred embodiments, but a skilled practitioner can make modifications or substitutions without departing from the scope or spirit of the invention.

• The present invention relates to an improved method for producing 143a (1,1,1-trifluoroethane) by continuous gas phase hydrofluorination of 1,1-difluoro-1-chloroethane (142b) using heterogeneous catalysis.
• The invention provides a practical process for the production of 143a with very high conversion (over 99%) and very high selectivity (over 99%) for 143a.
• In U.S. Pat. No. 3,231,519, a catalyst composed of coprecipitated iron hydroxide and rare earth oxide was used to hydrofluorinate 1,1,1-trichloroethane (140a), but the conversion and selectivity were low (83.9% and 42.67%, respectively).
• In U.S. Pat. No. 3,287,424, arsenic trifluoride and antimony pentafluoride were used as fluorinating agent and catalyst, respectively, but the fluorinating agent is toxic and expensive for industrial applications.
• In U.S. Pat. No. 3,803,241, a catalyst composed of chromium (III) chloride supported on alumina was used, but the catalyst required a very long time for regeneration, which is not practical for industrial applications.
• The invention uses a Cr catalyst, which may be unsupported or supported, in the absence or presence of a cocatalyst selected from nickel, cobalt and manganese salts, to achieve high conversion and selectivity for 143a.
• The process can be carried out at a temperature between 30° C. and 400° C., preferably between 30° and 280° C., more preferably between 100° and 250° C., and at a pressure between 1 atmosphere (0 psig) and 200 psig. The molar ratio of HF:142b can vary between greater than 1:1 and 20:1, preferably between greater than 1:1 and 10

• The present invention provides methods and apparatus for measuring and removing rotational variability from the nip pressure profile of nip presses using imbedded sensors in covered rolls.
• The invention utilizes multiple sensors circumferentially spaced at various cross-directional positions along the sensing roll to cancel rotational variability and obtain a more true measurement of the pressure distribution across the nip region. The use of multiple sensors also allows for the calculation and display of a rotational variability profile, providing real-time information for obtaining a more accurate nip pressure profile.

* The invention is an apparatus mounted on an ironing board that guides a cord of an iron and provides a holder for an article. The clamp section of the apparatus is C-shaped with a pair of leg portions, one engaging the ironing surface and the other adjustable for securing the apparatus to the ironing board.
* The flexible cord support is pivotably attached to the clamp and supports the electrical cord above the ironing board. An article holder is also mounted to the clamp for holding an article, and an electrical receptacle is carried by the clamp for receiving the plug of the electrical cord. In a preferred embodiment, the clamp has a movable jaw that engages the underside of the ironing board for securing the apparatus, and the flexible cord support has a resilient spring section that permits movement between a raised position and a retracted position.

• The present invention is a method and apparatus for spinning thermoplastic polymer filaments using non-eductive drawing.
• Conventional eductive systems create high levels of turbulence and vorticity, leading to filament entanglement and limiting product uniformity.
• Conventional non-eductive systems have fiber spin speed limitations due to large structural loads and pressure deflection.
• Hybrid systems combine eductive and non-eductive elements to increase spin speeds but are complicated and capital intensive.
• The present invention uses an initial quench chamber and a continuous two-dimensional slot across the entire machine width for good cross-machine uniformity.
• No air is educted into the system as the quench fluid undergoes uniform acceleration into the impingement slot, where the drawing force is developed.
• The drawing chamber is relatively small with no nozzle length parallel to the fiber/air stream, allowing for higher quench pressures and uniform web formation.
• The small amount of close tolerance machined surface area exposed to the fiber stream collects less dirt, polymer drippings, and monomer build up than other systems.
• The apparatus should be operated within certain ranges of parameters, such as quench air temperature, air flow rate, and slot opening length, for optimal filament properties.

* The present invention relates to a method of manufacturing a two-sided nonwoven fabric with a three-dimensional image, suitable for various consumer applications.
* Conventional textile fabric production involves multiple steps, including carding, drawing, roving, spinning, and weaving. Nonwoven fabric production is more efficient as it involves producing fabrics directly from the carding process.
* Nonwoven fabrics have been disadvantaged in terms of fabric properties, particularly in terms of resistance to elongation. Hydroentangled fabrics have been developed to improve physical properties and durability.
* The present invention involves forming a nonwoven fabric from a first precursor web and a second precursor web, with a fluid-pervious support layer or scrim interposed between them. The construct is then subjected to hydroentanglement on a moveable imaging surface with a three-dimensional image transfer device.
* The use of a support layer or scrim as a fiber distribution control layer benefits the fabric by preventing excessive intermingling of the fibrous constituents of the two outer layers. The resulting fabric exhibits a pronounced difference in surface performance properties inherent to the fibrous matrix used.
* The fabric can be made from various fibrous matrices, including staple length fibers and substantially continuous filaments. The support layer can be a woven, knit, open mesh scrim, or nonwoven fabric. A thermoplastic spunbond nonwoven fabric is a particularly preferred embodiment. The fabric can be used in various end-use products, including disposable absorbent hygiene articles, medical gauze, facial or hard surface wipes, protective wear, and covers for vehicles and equipment.

* The invention relates to a connective knitting method for joining two tape-shaped knit pieces using a flat knitting machine.
* Two tape-shaped knit pieces are knitted with a boundary between them on a flat knitting machine with movable needle beds.
* When both pieces reach a specified length, the loop portion of the moving side knit fabric is transferred to the needles of the fixed side knit fabric.
* The loop of the moving side knit fabric is overlaid on the loop of the fixed side knit fabric, and a new loop is formed, decreasing one loop in the moving side knit fabric.
* This process is repeated, decreasing two loops in total and connecting the end parts of both knit fabrics.
* The final end portion of the junction is prevented from loosening by forming a new loop on an overlaid loop.
* The knitting machine used is a flat knitting machine with multiple knitting needles on needle beds that can move and slide back and forth.
* The method can be used to join tape-shaped knit pieces in various parts, such as the collar of a sweater, neck rope portion of a tanktop, lower end portion of baseball stockings, and neck rope portion of an apron.
* The two pieces of knit fabric are knitted together and the transfers are carried out by a controlled computer following a designed knitting pattern.
* The method improves productivity and reduces manufacturing cost by eliminating the need for separate sewing processes.
</summary>

* The invention provides a lockstitch sewing machine with a rotary hook where the housing side holding means hinder the guiding of the needle thread loop and pull-back as little as possible.
* The needle thread loop can be expanded totally unhindered until its maximum expansion is reached, and then pulled back by the thread take-up lever without touching the front cam.
* The slight impediment of the thread movement caused by the bending of the spring rod can be eliminated completely by the capsule release device giving the bobbin housing a rotational impulse counter to the direction of hook rotation.
* The invention includes a rotary hook arrangement with first and second cams arranged on respective sides of a projection of the bobbin housing, and a spring rod extending between the cams that cooperates with a projection of the housing.

The first and second reflecting portions are provided opposite the end faces of the light sending and receiving optical fibers, allowing light to be transmitted and reflected efficiently.

The electrical signals generated by the light receiving devices can be used to detect sewing machine control signals such as speed, needle UP and DOWN positions, and thread trimmer timing position.

* The present invention provides an arrangement for controlling thread tension in a spool creel with multiple spool holders, each having a controller with a brake rotor, adjustable braking element, tensioning lever, and a fluid pressure-sensitive biasing arrangement.
* Each controller is coupled to a different spool holder, and all controllers are simultaneously settable by fluid pressure. The tensioning lever has a roller that engages threads and occupies an angular position dependent on thread tension and weight.
* The biasing arrangement, activated by fluid pressure, influences the tensioning lever and alters thread tension, which can be centrally set for the entire creel. When the warping machine is shut off, the braking force throughout the creel can be increased for quick braking.

- The inventors developed a small deaeration tank for removing oxygen from pulp before washing, preferably with the same diameter as an oxygen reactor and no moving parts.
- The deaeration tank has an inlet pipe, an outlet, and a tangential swirl inducing inlet pipe. The swirl inducing fluid is the filtrate from the washer after the oxygen bleach.
- The tank is cylindrical with an open top and a flat bottom, and its diameter is the same size as the oxygen reactor or between 0.75 to 1.5 times its diameter. The tank is high enough to prevent the swirling slurry from spilling over the sides.
- The inlet pipe allows the pulp to enter the tank above the surface of the slurry and splash against the side wall, and it is located from the top of the tank a distance equal to 10-50% of its height.
- The outlet is located in the bottom plate of the deaeration tank and is sized to handle the amount of pulp leaving the tank, with an outside diameter between 0.12 and 0.2 times the tank diameter.
- The oxygen filled slurry enters the tank through the inlet pipe and splashes against the side wall, and the height of the slurry is controlled by a height sensor at the bottom of the tank.

</summary>

• The present invention relates to a building system that allows for larger and non-square or non-rectangular panels in stucco type cavity wall construction without movement control joints.

• The invention allows for precise adjustment of the inboard rollers relative to the platform.

* The present invention introduces a brace for ladders with large contact area braces to increase stability and prevent damage to work surfaces.
* The brace assembly includes an extension arm with a flange and a U-bolt that secures the flange to the ladder rung, and a resilient pad assembly for non-slip gripping.
* The large contact area braces can be used on both sides of the ladder and can be adjusted to accommodate different ladder sizes.
* The invention also allows ladders to straddle corners by pivoting the resilient pad assembly horizontally, increasing accessibility and stability.

<summary>

* The present invention relates to a floor transport system for use in a fluid treatment chamber to prevent contamination of the sanitary environment by truck wheels.
* One embodiment includes a wheel channel with opposed sidewalls, one extending upwardly more than the other, and a cover plate horizontally overlying the top of the channel to prevent showered fluid from entering.
* The cover plate can be pivoted away from the wheel channel for cleaning.
* Another embodiment structures the floor track to accommodate trucks with downwardly depending struts, using inflatable elastomer seals to enclose around the struts and prevent entry of brine solution.
* The enclosed floor track system prevents contaminated brine solution from entering the track system and drains away any solution that does enter.
* The use of an enclosed floor track system prevents corrosion of wheel bearings, deterioration of rubber wheels, and contamination of brine solution.
* The present invention fulfills the need for an enclosed floor track system to prevent brine solution from coming into contact with hand truck wheels and becoming contaminated.
* The enclosed floor track system can be constructed of stainless steel to resist corrosive attack by the brine solution.
* The present invention allows for quick and versatile meat product transportation while maintaining the sanitary nature of the cooling fluid for reuse.
* The enclosed floor track system enhances the recovery and reuse of the brine solution, preserving natural resources and achieving economic advantages.
* Numerous changes in the details and construction of the enclosed floor track system may be made without departing from the scope of the invention.

</summary>

• The present invention relates to a plastic collation system for strip-formed fasteners that reduces debris and improves adhesion to the nail shanks. The system uses a plastic material that is molded and adhered to the nails, enhancing rigidity and reducing corrugation.
• The plastic material is formulated from an adhesive polymer, such as a maleic anhydride modified polypropylene, and is preheated before application to improve adhesion. The system includes a collar portion that encircles the nail shank and a connecting portion between adjacent nails, with various configurations such as bridges and ribs. The connecting portion includes a preferentially weakened region to encourage separation at a desired location, reducing debris and improving tool performance.

• The document describes a problem with conventional composed stave floors or engineering floors, which have a thin sight substrate that warms up and deforms during sanding or maintenance, affecting their physical, aesthetic, and functional properties.
• An example embodiment proposes a solution by providing a sight substrate with a thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate with a thickness of at least 12 mm, which are assembled together using glue and multidirectional holding means, including dendrites, adhesion and horizontal reinforcement means in the union plane, and adhesion and vertical reinforcement means normal to the union plane.
• The use of multidirectional holding means prevents displacement or change of dimensions, allowing the floors to have a longer useful life and enabling corrective maintenance, while also providing improved aesthetic properties and resistance to scratches and peeling.

• The text describes a lighting system for aquariums using LEDs and a modular design.
• The system includes a light member with a housing, lighting control region, and switch for controlling the white light channel.
• Each lighting control region has a groove with control channels for white and blue light, and a neutral channel.
• The modules, each with LEDs, can be coupled to the lighting control region and only installed in one orientation for proper electrical connection.
• The system allows for adjustable color temperature output by controlling the intensity of white and blue light.
• Additional features include the use of a single power cord, interchangeable modules with various LED colors and optical elements, and remote control options.

<summary>
• The text describes various embodiments of geological formation pressure sensing systems that more accurately measure formation pressures at desired depths.
• The inlet to the pressure sensing apparatus is located at a desired depth in the formation and isolated to pressures produced by the formation at such depth.
• The first embodiment involves drilling a borehole, installing a grout pipe, and lowering a pressure sensor arrangement into the borehole. The filter in the arrangement is cleared of cement grout and then connected to the formation pressure.
• The second embodiment uses a larger tube connected to a smaller fluid injection tube, which is used to clear the filter of cement grout and create a communication path between the filter and the formation pressure.
• The cement grout isolates the pressure transducer in the borehole, except for the laterally adjacent portion of the geological formation where fluid pressure measurements are desired.
• The pressure transducer is removable and relocatable within the large tube, allowing for servicing or relocating to a depth suited to its pressure range.
</summary>

• The text discusses the importance of measuring pressures in geological formations for engineering and environmental matters.
• Traditional piezometers involve standpipes with significant volumes, requiring adequate permeability and storage characteristics in the formation.
• Pneumatic piezometers and electrical transducers were developed to overcome volumetric problems and improve long-term drift characteristics.

• The text describes a method of monitoring fluid pressure in a subterranean formation using a conduit, a non-return valve, and cementitious material.
• The cementitious material is pumped into the borehole and displaced around the bottom inlet end of the conduit to form a fluid connection to the formation.
• A pressure sensing device is coupled to the formation fluid pressure within the conduit to measure the fluid pressure of the formation at the desired depth.
